alert.note: Alert for Tyrrell; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington and northwestern Tyrrell Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Scuppernong, or 19 miles east of Plymouth, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Woodley, Scuppernong and Creswell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
